news_title: Bitcoin Halving 2028 Date & Countdown | CoinGape
news_content: SIRWIN Bets.io Ybets Est. Time Remaining Predicted Date Remaining Blocks Total Blocks Live Bitcoin Price Market Cap The upcoming Bitcoin Halving event is estimated to take place in April 2028, approximately aftercalculating... Bitcoin halving event holds a special place in the crypto industry.  The event occurs every four years, after every 210,000 blocks are mined, reducing the supply of new coins circulating by half. Halving gradually reduces block rewards for miners, helping manage supply and demand to increase Bitcoin’s value. Halving is a direct reflection of the pseudonymous creator ofBitcoin, Satoshi Nakamoto’s vision, making it a valuable digital currency with limited supply. To maintain the value of Bitcoin through scarcity, the block rewards given to miners for processing transactions on the blockchain are halved. Nakamoto implemented the process into the Bitcoin code. The process of BTC halving will persist until all 21 million BTCs are mined. Completion is anticipated by the year 2140. To this point, BTC has experienced a total of three halving occurrences, which took place in 2012, 2016, and 2020. The most recent Bitcoin halving occurred on 11 May 2020, reducing mining rewards by 50% from 12.5 to 6.25 new bitcoins per block. The limited availability made Bitcoin bullish as its prices increased from $6877.62 on 11 April, one month before halving, to $8821 during the event. Despite experiencing considerable fluctuations, the price continued to rise throughout the following year and reached $49504 on 11 May 2021. A similar trend happened during the previous halvings in 2012 and 2016, with the most significant increase in value occuring after the event. The block rewards decreased by half to 12.5 BTC in 2016, and 6.25 BTC Despite a substantial decrease in value about 12-17 months later, the price still stayed much higher than before the halving in 2020. In the year 2024, the bitcoin block rewards will decrease to 3.125 BTC. A bitcoin halving is programmed into the foundational blockchain software of the network, controlling the speed at which new bitcoins are generated. The software makes computers in the network compete in a process called ‘mining’ to verify transactions, rewarding them with new bitcoins for proving the validity of selected transactions. Transactions are confirmed in clusters known as ‘blocks’ and the system is programmed to reduce the miner’s reward by half after every 210,000 blocks. Based on the Bitcoin price behavior in regards to the Halving event, there are 5 phases with different price chart patterns. While it is widely known that halving events bring price rally, there is more to its impact on the market price of Bitcoin. If we look at the price chart patterns of Bitcoin close enough, we can divide the impact into the following 5 phases. The Pre-Halving Downside phase occurs before the Bitcoin halving event, during which the cryptocurrency undergoes price decreases or corrections. During this period, there is a drop in the price of Bitcoin as traders expect the approaching halving event. The start of the Pre-Halving Rally phase indicates a change in market sentiment, suggesting Bitcoin may see upward movement before the halving. The Pre-Halving Rally phase usually takes place around 60 days prior to the Bitcoin Halving event. Bitcoin’s price experiences a sharp increase as investors look forward to the halving event. The surge in value is frequently driven by the anticipation of the event, prompting investors to join in on the enthusiasm. Short-term traders and speculators buy Bitcoin before the halving and selling soon after, employing a tactic called “Buy the Hype, Sell the News.” This action results in a Pre-Halving retracement. After the Pre-Halving Rally ends, the Pre-Halving Retrace phase usually occurs a few weeks prior to the Halving event. In this stage, Bitcoin sees a brief decrease in price. This period of retracement may continue for weeks, causing investors to wonder if the Halving event will actually result in a price increase for Bitcoin. Following the Pre-Halving retracement, Bitcoin moves into a stage called Re-Accumulation, marked by a prolonged period of stability or plateauing (consolidation) and horizontal movement. This period can last for as long as 150 days, which is approximately five months. Many investors might be disappointed because of the absence of substantial price changes after the Halving event. Some investors may choose to leave their positions early due to feelings of boredom, impatience, and disappointment. The actual Bitcoin price rally after the Halving event is anticipated to start in the last phase i.e., Parabolic Uptrend. When the price consolidation period ends after several months of Halving, Bitcoin price breaks out to witness a sharp uptrend movement. This phase previously led Bitcoin to record new all-time high prices and is estimated to happen this time as well. All the price predictions of BTC after Halving will hold true during this period with investors regaining optimism in Bitcoin investment. This leads to what we call a bull market since a price surge in BTC will have a positive impact on altcoins and other industry projects. Bitcoin undergo halving as aresult of its software being designed by an unknown individual or group who goes by the pseudonym ‘Satoshi Nakamoto’. Although Satoshi has not provided a clear explanation for halvings, it is believed by many that the purpose was to increase the initial distribution of coins in order to encourage more individuals to participate in the network and engage in block mining. According to this theory, block rewards were designed to decrease by half periodically since it was anticipated that the value of each rewarded coin would rise as the network grew. Another hypothesis suggests that the halvings were implemented to incorporate deflationary tactics in the currency, with a fixed number of new coins distributed per block. Contrary to the fiat money system’s tendency to decrease currency value through central bank overprinting, the fixed supply and predetermined rate of new bitcoin creation minimize this risk. Bitcoin halving has been criticized for promoting saving over spending, as users anticipate the coins’ price will rise. This could have sparked periods of rapid economic growth followed by sharp declines in the past, as individuals held onto coins until reaching certain levels before selling them. Others have made a comparison between bitcoin and a pyramid (Ponzi) scheme, citing that the design of the system has unfairly benefited early users. When the block reward is cut in half, certain users might realize that their mining operations will no longer be cost-effective because of expenses like electricity and equipment. If the price of bitcoin doesn’t increase enough, certain users might choose to completely stop mining, resulting in a decrease in processing power within the network. Regardless of the circumstances, the rate at which blocks are generated should remain constant because the software will adjust the complexity of verifying transactions accordingly. Once all 21 million bitcoins have been mined, users will stop earning new bitcoins for verifying blocks. Nevertheless, they will keep getting transaction fees – provided by those who are making payments – as a reward for verifying transactions. It is estimated that the final bitcoin will be mined by the year 2140. At this stage, the cryptocurrency will turn deflationary as coins can be ‘lost’  accidentally through user mistakes, such as sending them to an incorrect address. There are multiple ways you can trade the upcoming Bitcoin halving. You can either buy the coins onpopular crypto exchange platformsor speculate on its price changes by using derivatives like CFDs. In case you don’t want to interact with Bitcoin by directly buying and selling the coins on exchanges or wallets, CFD trading is the right option for you. Some of thebest CFD brokershelp you make speculative bets on the future prices of Bitcoin. Trading derivatives such as CFDs has following advantages when compared to trading Bitcoins directly on exchanges. Best CFD Brokers The first Bitcoin halving event took place on November 28, 2012, reducing the initial block reward of 50 BTC to 25 BTC. At the time of the event, the Bitcoin price was trading at around $13. Even though there was no substantial impact on the price right after the halving event, Bitcoin rose in value and reached the $1000 mark after 1 year, in 2013. The rising awareness of Bitcoin and gradually improving adoption are the major reasons behind this price rally, in addition to the halving event. The second Bitcoin halving event occurred on July 9, 2016, further slashed the mining rewards by half. This time, the block reward of Bitcoin was reduced from 25 BTC to 12.5 BTC. TheBitcoin pricewas trading at the $700 range during the event. Similar to the previous scenario, its price increased significantly and reached a new all-time high value of $20,089 more than one year after the event. The last Bitcoin halving or the third Bitcoin halving event took place on May 11, 2020. This time, the block reward of Bitcoin dropped from 12.5 BTC to 6.25 BTC. The Bitcoin price was around $8,000 when the third Bitcoin halving happened. It witnessed an incredible price surge in 2021 and finally reached the new all-time high value of over $68,000 in November 2021. Bitcoin Price has historically followed an upward price movement after halving events. However, we cannot say that it is only because of the halving events. While it is true that Bitcoin halving events reduce the supply and increase the value over the long term, they cannot directly alter price trends of Bitcoin. The price rise of Bitcoin majorly depends on the demand in market and user adoption. And, we cannot say for sure that the demand of Bitcoin will increase, considering the number of cryptocurrencies that exist in the market today. So, we cannot surely say that the upcoming Bitcoin halving will increase its price. What Are The Trending Crypto Coins of The Market Today? XRP Price Is About to Boom, Here Is Why? Another AI Bot Became a Millionaire Turning $1.5K Into $1.88M in Just 5hrs Is Hamster Kombat Price Capable of Hitting $0.1? Truth Terminal Creators X Hacked: $600,000 Lost In Memecoin Scam Why Is Gamestop (GME) Price Bullish Suddenly? There is a high possibility for Bitcoin reaching $100,000 after the upcoming Bitcoin Halving event in April 2024. Historically, the BTC price has always witnessed a price surge after each halving event. This time, the anticipation of the BTC price surge further increased with the upcoming Bitcoin spot ETF approvals. Though the Bitcoin price has always increased after halving events, there is no reliable metric to forecast when exactly the price rise happens. Sometimes, the Bitcoin price increased several months after the halving event. You should buy Bitcoin while its price is still low to benefit in the next bull run. For every 210,000 mined, which takes around four years, the Bitcoin block reward reduces by half. The mining difficulty gets adjusted to make sure that the Bitcoins are mined at a steady rate. In the upcoming Bitcoin halving in April 2024, the block reward reduces to 3.125 BTC and block height reaches 840,000. You can either directly buy Bitcoin on exchange platforms and wait for its price to increase in the future. Or, you can also enter CFD trading by speculating on the future price trends of Bitcoin. When a Bitcoin halving event takes place, it reduces the mining rewards. The major impact it will have on miners is their rewards will be reduced by 50% for successfully mining blocks. While Bitcoin halving is good for its long term price rise, miners may not appreciate it. news_content: SIRWIN Bets.io Ybets A cryptocurrency stock is a stock of a publicly traded company that runs operations heavily dependent on the blockchain or the cryptocurrency market. Popular cryptocurrency exchanges, cryptocurrency miners, blockchain technology experts, and other businesses with sizable cryptocurrency holdings on their balance sheets are among the companies whose stocks are included in this list. The cryptocurrency stocks can be easily accessed by anyone with an online brokerage account because they all trade on the Nasdaq Composite or NYSE in the United States. The majority of cryptocurrency stocks are expected to see their share prices rise over the long term if cryptocurrency adoption and use continue to grow across the globe, according to analysts and investors in the space. However, not every investor may want to make an investment of this volatility. It depends on your investment profile. If you are a seasoned investor and want to invest in an alternative asset class, crypto is a good option for you. However, if you are a novice trader and still learning the market dynamics, you might consider crypto investment a short term option. Cryptocurrencies are considered a comparatively volatile investment option. However, stocks have become a go-to investment alternative for the seasoned investors due to their less risky and less volatile nature. Socks have been an abiding and long-established asset class when compared to cryptocurrency. Stocks can yield both short and long-term returns. However, crypto is a recently established asset class with high volatility. Voice of Web3 podcast series aims to provide enriching information about the exciting world of cryptocurrencies and web3 technology in the form of panel discussions and AMAs with our esteemed guest speakers. We invite a new panel each episode who are experts in the respective fields as we explore several topics. However, we go beyond mere discussion and exploration. Voice of web3 podcast series explores the hottest and trending topics in each aspect of the cryptocurrency and web3 world. We have so far explored the NFT and Bitcoin space, while also keeping up with the Memecoin Craze. Additionally, we have also been able to narrow down and cover the ongoing controversy between the SEC vs Crypto Exchanges. This unrelenting dedication propels us ahead, and we remain dedicated towards our efforts to deliver on the same. Feedback from our audience is always appreciated because it helps us improve and live up to the standards set for us. We value your insightful opinions as we work to continually improve and provide a top-notch experience. Feel free to contact us with any feedback you may have. There is no fixed timing for the session as we have guest speakers joining us from various parts of the world. Pikamoon 8.                                                    FLOKI 9.                                                    PepeCoin 10.                                                    dogwifhat 11.                                                    Bone ShibaSwap After extensive analysis, these are the top meme coins that caught our eye. Some of them are new meme coins such as Popcat, while coins like Dogecoin have been around for years. Read on to learn why we chose these coins. Poodlana ($POOD) is a new meme coin that has gained attention in the cryptocurrency market, specifically in the Solana blockchain community. The presale of the coin has seen remarkable success, with around $3.5 million raised, showing significant investor enthusiasm. Poodlana is a luxurious dog-themed token, dubbed the Hermes of crypto. It has allocated 500 million tokens for sale, with the rest going to marketing, liquidity, partnerships, and rewards. Token holders can trade immediately after the sale, unlike other tokens that remain locked for months. The coin seeks to take advantage of the trend of meme coins, particularly in the Asian market, where it is predicted to succeed because of the cultural love for poodles and the high trading volume during Asian trading hours.  Memeinator is the new top meme coin. It is powered by a profound mission and possesses technology comparable to that of Skynet. It aims to revolutionize with strong marketing, innovative products, and an engaging action game. Memeinator is a well-made product to take over the meme coin market. With a 5-6% increase in the token’s cryptocurrency value guaranteed during each phase, thememeinator whitepapershowcases how the ICO structure has been carefully designed.  It is an initiative by Telegram founders to showcase the optimum utility of the Telegram channel by leveraging the meme coins community. Dogs Coin is thenewest meme coincreated to build a strong community of people in love with dogs and develop the welfare of dogs globally. It is designed on TON Blockchain. It seeks to foster a disruption of a community for those with similar interests in dogs, a platform to share one’s passion, and support organizations that support the welfare of dogs. The DOGS token is at the core of this ecosystem, and it will be used to promote Telegram  Apart from its not-for-profit objectives, it is an investment opportunity that will be interesting to those who have a special place in their hearts for dogs. People who hold DOGS coins have the opportunity to invest in a worthy cause while profiting from the cryptocurrency. With rising interest in cryptocurrency and dog-related initiatives, Dogs Coin’s market position may shift in the future making it one of thebest dog-themed meme coins to buy. All stars crypto is finally here after all the buzz and hype. The reason why this coin was enjoying the internet frenzy is clear. Within the three days since the presale announcement, All Stars has raised $382,225. All Stars meme coin is an innovative cryptocurrency that features meme vault for staking smart contracts.  As per thewhitepaper,  roadmap is primarily divided into three stages: memevault deployment, All Stars token launch, and presale. To participate in the presale, users will have to create a wallet, acquire cryptocurrency, and connect wallet. They will be able to stake the tokens and get benefits. It allows users to significantly stake All Stars by reserving 25% of the total supply for staking rewards. Staking is going to increase user earnings from the project. Dogecoin, the OG memecoin that started the meme revolution in the crypto industry. It is ‘the best memecoin’ that is ever created in the history. It is an open source peer-to-peer cryptocurrency supported by a vast community consisting of tech behemoth, Elon Musk. While theDogecoin Whitepaperdid not have a significant roadmap, its community has carried it along. Investment in dogecoin is something that does involves risk but also a hope for a big jump. Coming from a crypto enthusiastic community, Dogecoin has a reputation of showing unimaginable chart spikes.  Meme coins with a dog theme are always creative and incredibly entertaining. This is one of those. The Shiba Inu dog wearing a hat is the focal point of this coin, which runs on the Solana blockchain. Shiba Inus do not require an introduction. In the cryptocurrency world, it is one of the popular meme coins that is created a lot of buzz. In 2020, SHIB, best meme coin, entered this market with a wave of meme coins. Due to its decentralized structure and vibrant community, it attracted millions of viewers. Despite being nothing more than a meme at first, this token soon embraced a massive developer community that created a decentralized ecosystem around it. As per thewhitepaperEthereum-based SHIB token has become a global phenomenon by 2024 and is even accepted as payment on a number of platforms. Shiba Inus gained enormous popularity very fast because of the entertainment value they offered. SHIB’s price jumped from as low as $0.000000000056 to an all-time high of $0.000084.  Pikamoon is a recently launched, highly prospective memecoin. It is a blockchain-based gaming project. The “Pikaverse,” the project’s native metaverse, is explored by players as they engage in combat and search for gems. In this play-to-earn game, players advance through the four unique Pikaverse regions and receive rewards for completing tasks. According to thePikamoon Whitepaper, PIKA is used to redeem rewards. PIKA tokens can be exchanged for other tokens or used to buy in-game boosters like spells and potions. Additionally, holders of PIKA tokens will be qualified for a complimentary NFT. Pikamoon is anticipated to be the pepe coin of the meme world. As Pepe created a huge buzz and helped many recover losses, PIKA is likely to do the same. The coin is currently listed on popular exchanges like Bitget and MEXC. Pika is currently dealing at $0.001813. The marketcap of Pikamoon is $14.62M.  Another dog themed meme coin developed onERC-20. Floki Inu strives to be user-friendly and have a vibrant meme scene. It has three major features, namely, the meme, utility, and charitability. One could accurately refer to it as a cryptocurrency created by supporters and members of the Shiba Inu community. Floki whitepapermentions the intention behind introduction of $FLOKI was to give users interacting within the Floki Ecosystem a simple and safe way to settle disputes and make payments without the need for middlemen like centralized third-party entities, institutions, or credit.  Pepe Coin is a decentralized meme coin on the Ethereum blockchain, inspired by the popular internet meme “Pepe the Frog.” It was launched in 2023 and quickly gained popularity due to its association with the iconic meme. This cryptocurrency focuses on using the image of Pepe the Frog to develop a community and a viral marketing model. The meme coin trend can be explained by the fact that the more people hear about the meme, the more investors it can attract to participate in the coin. The Pepe Coin has a mechanism to increase the amount of supply that is being burned, thus decreasing the number of coins in circulation. This deflationary characteristic can lead to the ever-higher price of the tokens due to the constantly rising demand.  Dogwifhat is a new meme coin operating on the Solana network. It evolved from the Shiba Inu’s craze and is essentially an enlarged version of it in terms of appearance. Dogwifhat appears to be nothing more than a Shiba INU dog with a pink knit cap on. Dogwifhat, which is frequently referred to as a successful coin, has the potential to increase in value and provide investors with significant returns in the future. Experts predict that following the halving of Bitcoin, Dogwifhat will hit $9.9. So, make sure to keep an eye on this coin. Imagine that in a single day, your investment increased by 182%. This was only possible if you showed your money on Dogwifhat. In 2023, thissolana meme tokensaw an 182% increase in value on the first day of launch. This meme coin features a dog wearing a hat creating a massive community that has more than 50,000 members. This coin is now actively partnered with exchanges like Binance, realizing its enormous potential, and it functions well as a part of the Solana ecosystem.  Bone ShibaSwap is a shibaarmy token that helps the community cast their vote on the upcoming proposals in the domain. It is a governance token for the Shibaswap ecosystem. The value of your vote increases with the number of Bone tokens. While the Shiba token is already popular and priced by the market, we expect other coins in its ecosystem like $BONE to surge next. In terms of the number of tokens in circulation, BONE, which has 250,000,000, is perfectly positioned in the market.  A meme coin is a type of cryptocurrency that derives its identity from a meme, animal, or comical character. These depictions are often humorous and easily recognizable, which helps to attract a dedicated community. Meme coins rely heavily on community support and social media campaigns to gain popularity and increase in value. The community-driven nature of these coins means that their value is often influenced by social media trends, celebrity endorsements, and overall market sentiment. Dogecoin is the meme coin with the largest market cap and utility. It is a utility meme coin and has a strong ecosystem. Dogecoin is both a means of payment and a store of value. Furthermore, Elon Musk’s support for Dogecoin also adds to its appeal. So, from an investment perspective, it makes sense to hold DOGE. This makes Dogecoin one of the best meme coins to invest in. However, most of the coins on this list were well-researched and good options if you want to get into meme coins. Here are the top meme coins by their market cap: The price was last updated on 15th October 2024. If you’re looking to find new meme coins, you must consider what drives their value. Here are some common factors that drive the price of the top meme coins: A meme coin is considered successful if it can secure social media hype. Think of some of the most successful meme coins like Dogecoin, Shiba Inu and Pepe. Social media played a huge role in the growth of these coins. Social media creates hype and FOMO. Once the project secures social media visibility, its prices soars as well as trading volume. A project’s community plays a huge role. Top meme coins like Dogecoin have solid community support. Active communities can create value for a project through coordinated buying, social media campaigns and other marketing efforts. Elon Musk’s public endorsement of Dogecoin was one of the milestone moments for meme coin. Celebrity endorsement often influences the prices of the top meme coins as they can sway public opinion about the coin and drive interest. Listing on prominent exchanges like Binance, KuCoin, Coinbase, and OKX often affects the prices of meme coins. These listings often lead to increased visibility and create a sense of credibility about the project. Predicting which meme coin will reach $1 is challenging due to the volatile and speculative nature of these assets. However, several factors can influence their potential to reach this milestone including community support and social media presence. Dogecoin, Shiba Inu and Floki are the most likely meme coins to reach $1 thanks to their large market caps and community support. There are several factors to consider when getting a meme coin. This includes the exchange you’d like to use. There are lots of exchanges to pick from. But we advise that you pick reputable exchanges like Binance, OKX, Kucoin, eToro, Kraen, and Bitget. It is also important to consider if the exchange supports users from your country. Some exchanges are best suited The following are the steps you’d need to follow to make your first meme coin purchase: Step 1:Pick an exchange/Create an account Step 2:Select your funding method. There are different options to make your purchase. Some exchanges support debit/credit card purchases  or direct crypto deposits. Step 3:head to the exchange’s trading pairs and search for your meme coin Step 4:Choose an amount Step 5:Confirm purchase Step 6:Transfer to a hard wallet for better security While this is the general process, the steps to buy meme coins will change depending on the exchange of your choice. Most meme coins have become popular due to their popularity and virality on social media platforms such as X and Reddit. Dogecoin took off when Elon Musk started joking about it and started posting memes on X. Similarly, early Shiba Inu investors banded together to form the “Shib Army.” They were an enthusiastic community promoting $SHIB on every social media platform through memes and engaging with new users. Eventually, it worked. They were able to bring in more new users into the Shiba Inu ecosystem, which led to a price increase of $SHIB and created an even larger community. See below for a 1-year growth chart of $SHIB.  While Meme coins are often highly  speculative, they have provent to be beneficial in other aspects. It is without a doubt, that most investors are looking to invest in meme coins for their returns. Some meme coins like Doge and Shiba have given multi-fold returns in the past and new meme coins could do just that. Most meme coins explicitly don’t have any utility. Investors are attracted towards them for their community. For example, cat-lovers and people who love cat-themed memes are drawn towards MEW and their community. A crypto presale allows investors to buy tokens ofnew cryptocurrenciesand blockchain projects before they are listed on exchanges. These presales often involve multiple stages with varying token prices and incentives. Tokens acquired during presales are usually priced lower, offering early supporters a discount, but they cannot be traded until the project launches on exchanges successfully. Understanding how crypto presale pricing works is essential. Each project may utilize a unique pricing mechanism, which can significantly impact investment outcomes and project funding. In this section, we explore the various pricing models used in crypto presales which are tiered pricing and fixed pricing. Tiered Pricing is a prevalent model in crypto presales. This approach involves selling tokens at incrementally increasing prices across multiple stages.Here’s a breakdown:  The number of stages in a tiered pricing structure can vary widely and is solely dependent on the project’s specific needs and goals. There is no standard answer to how many stages a project might have—it could range from 5 to 15 or even more. This flexibility allows projects to tailor their presale strategies to optimize funding and attract a diverse group of investors. Tiered pricing offers several advantages. It incentivizes early investment by offering lower prices initially, creates a sense of urgency as prices rise, and helps projects generate steady funding momentum. This structured approach can attract a wide range of investors and ensure sustained interest throughout the presale period. The second pricing model is, fixed price. Fixed pricing in crypto presales offer tokens at a constant price throughout the presale period. Overall, fixed pricing simplifies the buying process by providing a streamlined purchasing experience and reduces potential confusion by avoiding the complexities associated with fluctuating prices. In a fixed price crypto presale, tokens are offered at a constant price throughout the entire sale period. For instance, consider a presale where each token is consistently priced at $0.03. This stable pricing strategy continues without any fluctuations, allowing the project to raise a total of $1,500,000. An Initial Coin Offering (ICO) is the launch of a new cryptocurrency and the sector’s equivalent to an initial public offering (IPO). ICOs are crowdfunding methods of crypto projects, where interested investors can support aupcoming ICOproject by buying its native crypto tokens. ICOs are a way for new crypto projects to gain funding and attention or launch a coin, token, app, or service. As well as the data in our top ICO list, there are a number of characteristics to look for to identify the best ICOs. First, find out the potential return you could gain on the project, then balance any risks. Here’s a quick list to get you started. A founding team and any visible backers or advisors should be visible on a top ICOs website. You can then research this team’s reputation by checking Google or LinkedIn. Just like checking out a project’s founders, take a look at the developers; sometimes this is one and the same. What’s their experience? What successful projects have they already completed? The core of the ICO is the whitepaper. Whitepapers should be clear, well-written, and understandable and detail the project’s achievable aspirations, ICO terms, technical aspects, and any prudent information for investors. Top ICO roadmaps are clear and achievable and should allow investors to check a project is on track. Above all, a good ICO should demonstrate transparency for investors. If you are struggling to find information to answer any of your prudent questions, it could be a sign of a problem. This has two facets: review the technology the ICO will use for its development, network, and coin, and if the ICO is funding new technology, then is that technology viable? It’s always wise to take a look at an ICO’s social media channels, take a look at the social media accounts of the founders and team, and see what other people are saying about the project on social media and in forums. The chances are a good ICO has already been reviewed by a number of analysts who are usually unbiased and will give an open opinion on the project’s aspirations and the potential return. Finally, make sure you can find and review in detail any terms and conditions relating to your investment, including how the coin will be issued, governed, and managed in the future Investing in ICOs requires careful selection and thorough research to mitigate risks and maximize potential returns. Begin by identifying promising ICOs, then delve into detailed analysis to determine the best fit for your investment goals and risk tolerance. Further, understanding the risks involved in ICO investments is crucial. That is why we have listed some of the common risks with ICOs. Investing in ICOs carries significant regulatory uncertainty, as many jurisdictions have yet to establish clear guidelines or laws governing these investments. This lack of regulation increases the risk of potential legal challenges or regulatory changes affecting your investment. Unlike traditional investments, ICOs often lack investor protections such as disclosure requirements and regulatory oversight. This absence of safeguards increases the risk of fraud, market manipulation, and loss of funds due to unforeseen circumstances. The cryptocurrency market, including ICOs, is highly volatile and prone to speculative trading. Fluctuations in market sentiment and external factors can lead to rapid price changes, posing substantial risk to investors who may experience significant gains or losses in short periods. Many ICO projects are early-stage ventures with unproven concepts and business models. Investing in these projects carries the risk of technical failures, project delays, or even abandonment, impacting the project’s ability to deliver on its promises and affecting investor returns. On the whole, people buy ICOs with the expectation that the coins they buy will gain in value when they become listed on exchanges and/or when the project is fully completed. ICOs can see new cryptocurrencies sold at low prices, and cryptocurrencies can gain value quickly when they are released to the open market, but they can also quickly depreciate in value. The other reason to invest in an ICO is to support the technology, product, or service that is being developed. ICOs have funded some of the most important technological developments in the blockchain space, like the Ethereum smart contract blockchain and other third-generation blockchains answering problems that will help crypto reach mainstream adoption. Once you have completed your thorough research into a top ICO you want to buy, the next part of your investment is to buy the ICO tokens. The likely steps you’ll take are as follows: You’ll either have a compatible wallet already or need to download and set up a wallet. Always make sure you use a reputable product and follow the maximum security options to ensure your transfers and balances are safe. Most ICOs will specify the crypto they accept in return for the ICO tokens; usually, this will be a coin like Ethereum or Tether. Each ICO will outline specific “How to Buy” instructions. Often, this consists of connecting your wallet and making the transfer of the cryptocurrency you will be paying with. The ICO you are investing in will have outlined how and when you will receive your ICO tokens. Selecting the best ICOs to invest in requires a strategic approach with thorough research and analysis. From blockchain innovations to decentralized finance (DeFi) projects, these ICOs offer promising opportunities for investors looking to capitalize on emerging technologies. Projects like Mbxau,All Stars, FortifiedX stand out for their innovative solutions and strong market potential, backed by robust teams and effective use cases. These crypto ICOs not only promise disruptive advancements in sectors such as technology, AI, DeFi, etc. but also aim to address real-world challenges through blockchain technology. Table of content An ICO works by allowing early investors to buy tokens with cryptocurrencies like ETH or BNB, by sending funds to a provided wallet address, with token prices set based on demand. Initial Coin Offerings (ICOs) are widely unregulated but can be legal if they comply with SEC regulations. Buy ICOs directly through crypto exchange platforms like Binance, Coinbase, OKX or others. You can also follow the steps on this page to make a direct buy of New ICOs. A few ICOs, such as Ethereum, have yielded significant returns for investors. Cloud mining is a process where individuals can mine cryptocurrencies by renting mining power from companies that own and operate the mining equipment. In cloud mining, the mining company owns and maintains the network of computers needed for cryptocurrency mining. When a block is successfully mined, new cryptocurrency is minted and awarded to the miner. Traditional Mining: Involves setting up and maintaining your own mining equipment. Platform Risk:The risk that the provider may be fraudulent or fail to deliver promised services.Contract Risk:Unclear or unfair contract terms can lead to financial losses.Mining Difficulty:Increases in mining difficulty can reduce profitability.Price Volatility:Fluctuations in cryptocurrency prices can impact your returns.Consensus Changes:Changes in the blockchain consensus algorithm can render mining contracts obsolete. It has been appreciated for the top-tier trading instruments, low fees, and multiple types of accounts. Interactive Brokers is aimed at the provision of its services to both individual and institutional customers and is a member of several financial bodies. Among the available platforms, Interactive Brokers provides its clients with Trader Workstation (TWS) and IBKR Mobile. Each of them offers a vast number of options – charts, indicators, and types of orders, for example. Interactive Brokers also have several types of accounts, which include individual accounts, joint accounts, trust accounts, and corporate accounts. Interactive Brokers has a clear regulation by several regulating authorities, including the SEC of the US, the FCA of the UK, and ASIC of Australia. This gives a guarantee that the company works equitably without prevarication and that their client’s money is secured.  Interactive Brokers is suitable for the trader who is in search of an online trading system that offers a myriad of financial products and features. However, it can be inconvenient for newcomers since some of the offered trading instruments are quite difficult to understand. AvaTrade is an online trading company that deals in forex, CFDs, stocks, and Indices, among other trading instruments. This company has gained popularity mainly because of its easy-to-use trading terminalcopy tradingfeatures, relevant materials, and multiple account types. AvaTrade offers trading services to both retail and institutional investors and has licenses from several financial bodies. It provides its users with a smooth cryptocurrency exchange on AvaTrader. It offers wide access to numerous features and aspects, such as charts, indicators orders, etc. AvaTrade also renders various materials, such as webinars, articles, and video tutorials, for the insights about the crypto markets. AvaTrade has received its regulatory approval from the Central Bank of Ireland, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) the United Kingdom, and the Australian Securities and Investment Commission (ASIC). This is to ensure that AvaTrade is operating in a way that is fair and the money clients deposit with them is well protected.  In particular, AvaTrade is an appropriate platform for those traders who need a simple interface to trade various financial assets and appropriate educational material. However, it is not the kind of trading platform ideal for experienced traders who need highly specific and detailed tools to trade. Exness is a professional forex and CFDs broker that provides clients with an opportunity to trade online. Being one of the most rapidly developing Forex brokers, Exness is known for its low latency, fast trade execution, and wide asset list that is suitable for both, small investors and large institutional entities. Being regulated by such governing bodies as FCA in the UK, CySEC, and FSA in Seychelles, Exness provides secure trading services for its clients.  To abide by the needs of the varied clients, Exness provides several platforms for trading, intended for various types of traders. The broker provides its clients with two primary platforms, MetaTrader 4 (MT4) for experienced traders and MetaTrader 5 (MT5) for those who want more bells and whistles. Furthermore, it offers Standard, Cent, and Pro account types, which also have their pros and cons, allowing traders to select an account type best suited for them. IC Markets is another top-ranked online forex and CFD broker known for low-cost trading and competitive bid/ask spreads. Considering the main goal to provide clients with a clear and swift trading environment, IC Markets is an ASIC, CySEC, and FSA-authorized company. IC Markets also provides various trading platforms, with leading trading platforms such as MT4, MT5, and cTrader. It helps them to give technical analysis, order flow, and risk management tools and facilities for the trade execution at the trader’s preferred platforms.  IC Markets provides its clients with multiple account types that allow satisfying the needs of traders and their preferences: raw spread, standard, and true ECN accounts. Furthermore, with the features listed above, IC Markets also offers a full complement of customer services to help traders out with their concerns or problems.  Customer support is available 24/5 of the week, and the broker’s team speaks multiple languages. A crypto broker is a company that acts as an intermediary for users who wants to trade crypto assets. It has a simple design and offers its users a way to purchase and sell a variety of digital currency, suitable for novices and professionals. Crypto brokers provide a larger number of cryptocurrencies than traditional crypto exchanges, and they also may include exotic tokens and altcoins. Such a broader choice allows for choosing less liquid and more promising securities and reaping a profit from forming trends. Besides, most cryptocurrency brokers offer other financial services that can be useful for cryptocurrency trading and increase the profitability of operations, including leveraged trading, borrowing, and even exchange traded funds. However, it must be understood that crypto brokers may not be as flexible and handy as any decentralized cryptocurrency exchanges. While you can easily purchase and trade in cryptocurrencies from these platforms, you may not be able to fully control your trades or avail of some of the enhanced trading features. Crypto exchanges are online markets where you can directly engage another party and sell/buy crypto assets from/to them. While thebest crypto exchangeshave larger selections of coins compared to crypto brokers, they serve a multitude of users with different requirements and tolerance for risk when trading crypto. Especially, they can offer a greater number of crypto assets, including many altcoins, pumps and dumps tokens, and exotic coins. Additionally, crypto exchanges may also offer other features that include staking, margin trading, and derivatives, andfutures tradingwhich give better trading opportunities. Crypto exchanges can be even more difficult to navigate than crypto brokers, a user will require more technical prowess and know-how. They may offer better trading platforms, more products to trade, better types of orders, and higher customization levels. But, this adds the extra profitable layer of flexibility for you and your trades along with the overall results. The following elements should be taken into account when selecting a cryptocurrency broker: When selecting the best cryptocurrency broker, it is of essence to consider the reputation of the broker because this attribute determines the trust and reliability of the broker. Choose trustworthy broker who have been providing their services for a few years and who are popular among users and other top crypto brokers. Such brokers tend to be more experienced and are rated highly based on performance, reliability, and the exercise of ethical practices in the business. Also, prefer working with traditional online brokers supervised by other reputable financial markets like the FCA of the United Kingdom or the SEC of the United States. Looking at a reputable cryptocurrency broker, it would be clearly illustrated that the provider has little to no negative feedback from users, has strong security measures in place, and few to no scandals or legal problems. The review section, checking of their regulatory status, and searching for any past scandals would help in identifying an adequate broker. The cost factors include the fees charged by traditional brokers who provide cryptocurrency trading services, which affect profits. Some of the aspects that need to be considered include the fee charged by the broker for trading, deposit and withdrawal fees, and other charges. Some brokers demand the trader to pay them via a commission or through the spread when trading. Alow-fee crypto platformcould provide tiny spreads in the sense that they may charge a smaller difference between the buying and selling price of the crypto assets. Further, some brokers may also charge inactivity fees or fees for using certain services, for instance, withdrawing funds and/or engaging in other premium services. It is also prudent to understand the costs you need to fully identify with every transaction you make since high charges can reduce your returns, especially if you are planning to frequently trade cryptocurrencies. For this reason, identifying brokers’ fee structures will assist you in finding affordable brokers. Security is paramount when dealing with cryptocurrency trading, given the rise in cyberattacks and hacking incidents in the industry. Choose a right crypto broker that implements stringent security measures to protect your assets and personal information. These measures should include two-factor authentication (2FA) to add an extra layer of protection, cold storage for funds (where the majority of assets are stored offline), and encryption protocols to safeguard transactions and sensitive data. Reputable brokers often undergo regular security audits and are transparent about their security practices. Additionally, a good broker will have insurance coverage for digital assets, providing you with a safety net in case of breaches or hacking incidents. Look for brokers who are known for quickly addressing security concerns and who have not been involved in significant breaches. Prioritizing security helps mitigate risks, ensuring your investments remain safe in an unpredictable environment. Customer service is an essential component in facilitating efficient trading of products and services, particularly in the swiftly dynamic cryptocurrency market. Customer support should be available and dependable to assist in both technical concerns and account issues. It is recommended to work with the brokers who provide customer support round the clock since the cryptocurrency markets are open round the clock and problems can occur at any moment. The availability of support can be measured by the time taken to reply to a customer’s complaint, the courtesy of the support representatives, and the number of ways customers can contact the support team either through live chat, mailing, or calling. Some of the advantages of a good broker are also the presence of educational material and tutorials for both a beginners and an experienced trader, giving the customer a more complex experience. Heartwarming stories or positive words said about a broker’s customer support team can at times point to a broker’s loyalty to its clients. Timely customer service helps to solve problems when they appear and makes the trading process uninterrupted. Portfolio diversification is important to traders and investors who need a range of digital assets to meet the various opportunities in the market. Brokers who have many cryptocurrencies on offer allow the client to buy a more diverse portfolio, which may lead to generating more money. In addition to the leading cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin and Ethereum, the broker should offer a variety of other coins, including Solana, Chainlink, Polkadot, and some other new tokens that might have a better potential for growth. It enables traders to operate in several ways, from long-term investment to the speculative manner of trading. Also, the diversification of the offered cryptocurrencies might help the company access newer forms of cryptocurrency investments before they go viral. Still, it is also a good idea to know that the broker has adequate amounts of such assets to buy or sell them at your convenience. A broad spectrum of products is also believed to be a sign that the broker applies efforts toward meeting the demands of market evolution and offering its clients more options. Deciding on the ‘best’ crypto broker is relative, and it depends on what is most suitable for the user’s requirements and inclination. They include the number and varieties of cryptocurrencies available on the platform, the cost of transactions, the simplicity of the platform, security measures, responses to clients’ inquiries, and other services such as leverage and staking. It is impossible to conclusively determine that there is the best broker, but some excellent choices have emerged in the cryptocurrency market. On examples of companies, it is possible to name Coinbase as one of the leaders in the market thanks to its simple navigation, availability of many cryptocurrencies, and enhanced security. One popular platform is Robinhood, which offers hassle-free cryptocurrency trading without commissions and finds a lot of demand among inexperienced investors. Here’s why you’d want to use a crypto broker: The best cryptocurrency brokers have been developed with simplicity, and this aspect makes them suitable for both new and professional crypto traders. They have simple layouts, auto-generated order forms, and basic trading mechanisms that help you begin trading immediately. Cryptocurrency brokers usually demand lower commissions in comparison with other crypto exchanges, which is beneficial for small-scale operations. It can assist you in achieving your goal of enhancing your revenues and reducing your trading costs. Crypto brokers generally have a wider range of cryptocurrencies for trading crypto, and this includes new coins and different types of tokens. This means that you are offered a wider choice of investments, and you can choose from a greater number of stocks, bonds, etc. Some brokers provide other financial services apart from trading in cryptocurrencies and tokens. Some of these services might be like margin funding, a service that provides you with funds to open a larger trading position, and lending, where you can earn interest from your digital assets. As with any product, even the best cryptocurrency broker have their own set of limitations to deal with. Crypto brokers are not necessarily going to allow you the same amount of control of trading crypto that you have over your trades in crypto exchanges. You may have limited choices for modifying your orders, using sophisticated cryptocurrency trading platforms, or engaging in margin trading. Crypto brokers provide a rather broader base of cryptocurrencies than the cryptocurrency exchanges may provide but may generally not accommodate the exhaustive list as the exchanges. This could hamper investment opportunities and may reduce the freedom with which one could diversify his/her portfolio. Even the best cryptocurrency brokers, like any other online platform, do experience security threats. Although they usually do this to secure your money, it is not out of the question for breaches and hacks to happen. One must also avoid these risks by working with a reliable broker who has excellent security measures in place. The brokers dealing in cryptocurrency provide easy-to-use platforms where anyone can easily trade in cryptocurrencies thus making investment in cryptocurrencies easy. They can offer more cryptocurrencies than a standard cryptocurrency exchange and may have more services to help you trade and manage your money. However, it is imperative to give much consideration to the various brokers and choose the best that suits one’s investment needs and risk appetite. Please note that trading in cryptocurrencies is considered high-risk, and with that in mind, trading should not be done without ample research and knowledge of the risks involved. Table of content Yes, leverage trading is possible with cryptocurrency brokerage firms. This helps traders to amplify their positions. However, the leverage limit supported varies based on the chosen brokerage. Crypto trading brokers are not a necessity. If you only want to trade crypto coins, a dedicated crypto exchange might be well suited.  However, some crypto brokers help simplify trading processes and offer guidance on market prices, enhancing the overall trading experience.  Crypto brokers secure funds using different measures like cold storage, 2-factor authentication (2FA) for account access, encryption protocols to protect data and other regulatory measures such as funds segregation. Fund segregation reduces the risk of misuse or misappropriation. Other security tools include constant audits to identify and resolve possible vulnerabilities. These measures help create a sense of safety as users interact with these brokers. CoinGape prepared areview methodologyto rate crypto exchanges, tools, and apps.
